key_points: Tiger Woods survived a severe car crash in Los Angeles and is considered fortunate to be alive.
The crash involved Woods' SUV hitting a median and rolling approximately 100 feet off the road.
Los Angeles County Sheriff's Department deputy Carlos Gonzalez reported Woods was calm, lucid, and wearing his seatbelt at the scene.
Woods sustained serious injuries to both legs and was undergoing surgery at Harbor-UCLA Medical Center.
Los Angeles County Sheriff Alex Villanueva stated there was no evidence of impairment at the crash scene.
There was no attempt to draw blood at the hospital to test for impairment.
An investigation into the crash's causes is underway, with findings to be released in the coming days or weeks.
A minor second crash occurred when another driver stopped to help Woods, but no one was injured.
Sporting figures and Donald Trump have sent prayers and thoughts to Woods via social media.
The PGA legend's survival is attributed to his use of a seatbelt during the incident.
spokespersons: Carlos Gonzalez (Deputy, Los Angeles County Sheriff's Department)
